Title: Golden Pass LNG start-up slips to late-2025
Description: ExxonMobil, project partner in the 15.6 mtpa Golden Pass LNG export project in Texas, expects the facility to delay its start-up to late 2025 from the earlier expectation of a mid-year start after lead contractor Zachry Holdings declared bankruptcy and exited the project.
Author: JS

Title: NFE sets date for Altamira FLNG's commissioning, first cargo
Description: US LNG project developer New Fortress Energy, or NFE, expects to complete commissioning of its delayed 1.4 mtpa Altamira Fast LNG floating unit offshore Mexico and to ship its first partial cargo on August 9.
Author: JS

Title: First train of Qatar’s North Field East LNG expansion 50% complete: Technip Energies
Description: Technip Energies, one of the engineering, procurement and construction contractors for QatarEnergy ‘s 32 mtpa North Field Expansion said that the first train has reached over 50% construction progress.
Author: JS

Title: India’s Swan Energy awaits shareholder approval of Vasant 1 FSRU sale to Turkey’s Botas
Description: India’s Swan Energy is waiting for its shareholders to approve the sale of its 180,000 m3 Vasant 1 floating storage regasification unit to Turkey’s state-owned Botas, raising questions about the future of the Indian firm’s planned 5 mtpa Jafrabad LNG terminal in Amreli, Gujarat.
Author: CK

Title: Malaysia’s Bintulu LNG plant faces output issues at Train 8, loading at terminal continues
Description: The Petronas-operated 29.2 mtpa Bintulu LNG export facility in Malaysia is facing production issues at its eighth liquefaction train, constraining exports and possibly spurring some offtakers to seek spot LNG cargoes for replacement, according to market participants. However, ships continue to berth at the terminal to load LNG.
Author: CK
